description: Mongols are a cavalry-focused civilization that excels in raiding and mobility.
dark_age: Start with 3 villagers, 1 scout, and 2 sheep.
Build 2 houses, a lumber camp near forests, and a mining camp near gold/stone.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scouts to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 16-17 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 150-200 wood, and 150-200 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 6-8 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 2-3 to gold, and 2-3 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional scouts or start producing archers from the archery range.
Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade units and sell excess resources for gold.
Advance to Castle Age at around 23-24 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 600-800 wood, 500-600 gold, and 400-500 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 15-20 villagers to food, 8-10 to wood, 5-6 to gold, and 5-6 to stone.
castle_age: Build a siege workshop and produce mangonels or scorpions to counter enemy units and buildings.
Continue producing cavalry units, such as knights or light cavalry.
Research husbandry and bloodlines to improve cavalry speed and hit points.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 30-31 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2000-2500 wood, 1200-1500 gold, and 1200-1500 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 30-40 villagers to food, 15-20 to wood, 12-15 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Produce elite Mangudai or Hussars to raid enemy economy and destroy buildings.
Research relevant upgrades to improve cavalry performance.
Have around 5000-6000 food, 3000-4000 wood, and 3000-4000 gold in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 50-60 villagers to food, 25-30 to wood, 20-25 to gold, and 20-25 to stone.
